questions.question: Father …………………….. the newspaper every day after breakfast.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habitual actions.

questions.question: We ……………………….. to church twice a week.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habitual actions and routines.

questions.question: The child …………………………… with her dog.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about an action or situation going on at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: She ………………………….. spending time with her dogs.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about likes, dislikes, habits, routines etc.

questions.question: My sister ………………………….. research in molecular biology.
What …………………………. tomorrow?
questions.description: The present continuous is often used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: Light ………………………… faster than sound.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about facts.

questions.question: If she ……………………….. out, we will be in trouble.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: My uncle …………………………… tomorrow.
questions.description: The present continuous is often used to talk about future events, if the plan already exists.

questions.question: She …………………………. at a bank.
questions.description: The simple present is used for more permanent situations.

questions.question: She …………………………. a short term course in computer science at the moment.
questions.description: The present continuous is used for temporary situations.
